data.title: Option serverside to save replays
data.body:
Would be nice to implement an option for the server owner to allow replays to be saved serverside primarily in the case of competition and tournaments. It would allow players to play unhindered by having an official or witness present. It would also be useful for casters as they could easily access tournament replays.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/28916272-option-serverside-to-save-replays?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: AttackBase and Armament optimizations
data.body:
- Removes redundant ITraitInfo from `AttackBase`.
- Moves `self.IsDisabled()` check in `AttackBase.CanAttack` up to first check, so later checks are skipped for disabled actors.
- Caches the assigned turret and `AmmoPool` as well als `BodyOrientation` and `rangeModifier` directly in `Armament` via `INotifyCreated` instead of using Lazy.

Note: Please review at least the 3rd commit very carefully, I'm not sure the performance impact is worth it and I'm not sure whether this might cause any regressions.
The approach of the last commit was simply copied from one of @RoosterDragon's PRs.

data.title: [Playtest-20151129] Cannot power down production facilities.
data.body: In original RA you could power down production buildings, why not in this one? Really useful early game when you get you're low on power and just need a little more to speed up construction but you don't have all the high tech power hungry stuff yet.

data.title: Cant repair buildings that are powered down. [Playtest-20151129]
data.body:
If you use the little electricity button to turn off a building then you click the wrench to repair it, it wont repair until you give it power.
Unless this is intentional for some reason?

data.title: Destroyer Max Range Damage Bug
data.body:
Basically when the destroyers are at max range they do 0 or effectively 0 damage.  FiveAces has mentioned this a lot but I didn't see anything in issues other than this [erroneously?] closed issue.
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8476

data.title: Fix showing unread messages count on active lobby chat button
data.body:
The lobby chat button text would change to include the unread messages count for a split second, even when the lobby chat was the current panel, leading to the button text sort of 'blinking' in an ugly way.

This is simple enough and provides better polish for a new feature that I think it's warranted to be added to the milestone.

data.title: Game crash at start (Windows 10)
data.body:
Since I have updated my OS from Win7 to Windows 10, I can't start OpenRa anymore.
Here is the exception.log:

```
Red Alert Mod at Version release-20150919
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.ArgumentException`: hires.mix (RA/TS/RA2 format, Encrypted: True, DataStart: 562308), duplicate values found for the following keys: 1944055308: [(offs=894417522, len=1944055308),(offs=894417522, len=1944055308),

[... lots of 'lens' and 'offs' following]

   bei OpenRA.Exts.ToDictionaryWithConflictLog[TSource,TKey,TElement](IEnumerable`1 source, Func`2 keySelector, Func`2 elementSelector, String debugName, Func`2 logKey, Func`2 logValue)
   bei OpenRA.Exts.ToDictionaryWithConflictLog[TSource,TKey](IEnumerable`1 source, Func`2 keySelector, String debugName, Func`2 logKey, Func`2 logValue)
   bei OpenRA.FileSystem.MixFile..ctor(String filename, PackageHashType type, Int32 priority)
   bei OpenRA.FileSystem.GlobalFileSystem.OpenPackage(String filename, String annotation, Int32 order)
   bei OpenRA.FileSystem.GlobalFileSystem.<Mount>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__0()
   bei OpenRA.FileSystem.GlobalFileSystem.Mount(String name, String annotation)
   bei OpenRA.FileSystem.GlobalFileSystem.LoadFromManifest(Manifest manifest)
   bei OpenRA.ModData.PrepareMap(String uid)
   bei OpenRA.Game.StartGame(String mapUID, WorldType type)
   bei OpenRA.Game.LoadShellMap()
   bei OpenRA.Mods.Common.LoadScreens.BlankLoadScreen.StartGame(Arguments args)
   bei OpenRA.Game.InitializeMod(String mod, Arguments args)
   bei OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
   bei OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   bei OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

I also tried to reinstall the game with no success. The installer process starts but there is no UI. I can't even kill the process via ProcessExplorer.

data.title: Fix TS Obelisk charge overlay Z offset
data.body:
To make sure it is played on top of the 'body'.

Closes #10108.

data.title: Fix AttackMove not working properly under certain conditions
data.body:
This fixes the issue where AttackMove (and possibly other order modes) would not work properly when people were clicking their mouse buttons at the same time. A move order (the default order mode) would be issued instead. See [here](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9851#issuecomment-162229788).

Fixes #9851.
Fixes #8023.

data.title: Homing AreaBeam weapon
data.body:
Followup feature request to #9357 which introduced an area beam A.K.A. line impact projectile.

The existing area beam weapon has a static target, not re-adjusting its aim if its target is on the move. Instead it just keep firing at the spot the target was when it started shooting.

This is fine for Railgun weapons (Ghost + Mammoth Mk2) but the original TS disruptor tanks tracked their targets with their beam even if the target moved.

The following behavior should apply for a `HomingAreaBeam`:
- Should have a `RangeLimit` similar to missiles, in that it can continue tracking the target until this many ticks have passed since it started being emitted.
- Otherwise function as the existing `AreaBeam`.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/28880963-homing-areabeam-weapon?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: More Customisable Crate Settings
data.body:
Currently we can have two Options about Crates, enabling and disabling them. I think we should turn them into dropdown menu and make min-max crate count settable from there. A (or 2, 1 for max, 1 for min) slider would be better but i don't think we have enough space on UI. Also with slider we can't implement another thing i want, "Orginal Crate Behavior"

In both CnC and Dune games there are same amount of  Crates that amount of Human Players. I think it should be implemented into OpenRA, but be selectable.

I'm not sure what numbers we should use if we select dropdown. Numbers in my mind are, 0-1, 1-2, 2-5, 5-10, 10-25 and 25-50. 10-25 and 25-50 should be some sort of Crate Game. We don't really need to have own maps for this game types. Most of maps are good to play with lots of Crates.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/28880851-more-customisable-crate-settings?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Remove junk ProximityCaptor values
data.body: I don't think we want walls, civilian field, trees, etc. to capture something.


data.title: If PipCount < 0, then use max / -PipCount
data.body:
Applies to:
- `AmmoPool` : `Ammo / -PipCount`
- `Cargo` : `MaxWeight / -PipCount`
- `Harvester` : `Capacity / -PipCount`
- `StoresResources` : `Capacity / -PipCount`

data.title: [IDEA] Pilot from downed aircraft.
data.body: Then you can upgrade a units veterancy with the pilot like in Generals? I dunno man, its just a idea.

data.title: Setting War Factory as Primary building doesn't work when having too many factories.
data.body:
When too many war factories are in the game, setting one as "primary" doesn't work anymore. Instead always the new placed factory is set as the primary and the only way to have a new spawn spot is to build another war factory.

Tested in Red Alert mod with Russian faction.

Regards, Ant

data.title: Hardware cursor option gets disabled and results in hidden cursor
data.body:
- Windows 8.1 
- Intel HD graphics 
- all OpenRA versions I tried recently (not a new thing) 

I noticed some time ago that the "HW cursor" option rets ~randomly disabled. In IRC logs I saw that this is a "fallback" thing if "problems" are detected. (What problems exactly?) 

It wasn't a problem for me before, since it didn't affect anything. Now my cursor disappears and stays hidden until I reenable the option and restart OpenRA (which is a pain since I can't see the cursor). 

~~It seems that it is maybe triggered by Alt-Tabbing (switching between windows).~~
~~Also it seems that it only happens with pseudo-fullscreen and not with the fullscreen. (But that's not a great alternative since capturing software seems to work only with pseudo)~~

EDIT: Nope, it also happens in "fullscreen" and without "Alt-tabbing".

What others say: :) 

> antares79: open the ticket against your gpu driver, not against us 
> ...
> hamb: the hw cursor disabling itself?
> hamb: swear i have that too
> ...
> jaZz_KCS: IF the focus is lost, apparently
> jaZz_KCS: I had the same problem

data.title: Add a link to the resource site on the Map Chooser
data.body:
Currently, the resource site is not really promoted on the openra.net website. The link is hidden in http://www.openra.net/community/ and I doubt many players visit the resource site from that page.

Why not adding a simple URL link, on the map chooser, at the bottom, next the the Random Map button?

![screenshot001](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/11568638/991315d4-99ed-11e5-801f-9f25883d76c9.png)

data.title: Fix a crash when producing an actor without OccupiesSpace...
data.body:
...in combination with UpgradeActorsNear.

Fixes #10167.

data.title: Added autoqueue feature.
data.body:
CTRL-~~Right~~ Left click on the queue to enable/disable auto queue.

Autoqueue makes the queue repeat itself infinitely until it's disabled or the items are removed which is very useful as it means you don't need to requeue units manually. Age of mythology has it.

I made the text color change to green to indicate when it is enabled.

data.title: Use heightmap to get correct groundlevel, use AircraftInfo for correct ground level
data.body: Same as in #10162 for the AttackPlane and ReturnOnIdle traits.

data.title: RA build queue isn't user friendly.
data.body:
I can not count the number of games I've lost because I've queued what I thought was a generous number of units. Only to run out of them, have too much cash, and see my build queue empty, just in time to get steamrolled. 

Two options that would fix this: 

Either play a warning sound when the queue is empty (similar to silo's needed).

Or, allow for setting an auto train unit. I.e. if I set my auto train unit to artillery, when the queue is empty, it'll auto build arty. But when queue any unit, it'll auto cancel the arty, and build that unit. Then once empty again, it'll automagically start building arty again.

data.title: TS obelisk only shoots once when force-firing
data.body: When ordering an obelisk (in TS) to shoot at an allied actor via force-fire, it will stop after 1 shot. Does not happen with TD obelisk, so it's probably a yaml rule issue.

data.body: // Irrelevant memes

data.title: Added cruising upgrade to aircraft
data.body:
Allows mods to toggle traits when reaching / leaving cruise altitude (e.g. hovering)

http://gfycat.com/FaithfulUnimportantAssassinbug

Fixes #9721 for all mods, makes the aircraft check in `Hovers.cs` redundant (see #10162)

data.title: fix hovers trait to use heightmap
data.body:
Uses the heightmap to get the correct altitude.
This was already worked around in Tiberian Sun via upgrades (#9716)

Since aircraft don't hover until reaching cruise altitude (at least in ts), I'd suggest reusing those upgrades in #10163

data.title: Updated music.yaml files (RA/TD/D2k)
data.body:
_Update: All three mod files have now been updated, made sure the correct names appear, made sure that regardless of what version you use (vanilla/expansion/content mirror) you have all files correctly listed, alphabetized and put into corresponding expansion section of the files, if applicable._

Added a one-liner to make sure the song "Afterlife" (await_r.aud) is loaded in both content data alternatives (Aftermath scores.mix from DL mirror / Base game scores.mix file from Game CD.)

Depending of which scores.mix file is used (the DL mirror one including the Aftermath expansion tracks or the vanilla one from "Install from CD"-option)
the naming of the file is slightly different. This results in missing out this song when using the bigger scores.mix file with the bonus tracks, since OpenRA can't find the file "await_r.aud", because in the expansion mix files, it is actually called "await.aud".

Closes #10160.
